member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.BackgroundFlags
member.summary: Defines constants that are used by the method.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.BackgroundFlags.NotSupported
member.summary: Background operations are not supported.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.BackgroundFlags.Download
member.summary: Download in background is supported.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.BackgroundFlags.Upload
member.summary: Upload in background is supported.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.BackgroundFlags.AskUser
member.summary: If this flag is set, the user must be asked BEFORE the transfer starts whether the file should be sent/retrieved in background or foreground. This is necessary for plugins where a separate connection is needed for background transfers, e.g. the SFTP (secure ftp) plugin. If the flag isn't set, there will be a "background" button in the actual progress window.

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password
member.summary: is a class, which the plugin can call to store passwords in the secure password store, read them back, or copy them to a new connection.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Save(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Save password to password store.
member.param: Name of the connection for this operation.
The password to be stored.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Load(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Load password from password store.
member.param: Name of the connection for this operation.
The password to be retrieved.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Load(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String@)
member.summary: Load password from password store.
member.param: Name of the connection for this operation.
If true load password only if master password has already been entered.
The password to be retrieved.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Copy(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy password to new connection.
member.param: Name of the source connection.
Name of the target connection.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Move(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Copy password to new connection and delete the source password.
member.param: Name of the source connection.
Name of the target connection.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Delete the password of the given connection.
member.param: Name of the connection for this operation.
member.returns:
Total Commander returns one of these values:
Success.
Encrypt/Decrypt failed.
Could not write password to password store.
Password not found in password store.
No master password entered yet.

member.summary: Requests the small 16x16 icon.

member.summary: The function is called from the background thread.

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconResult
member.summary: Defines constants that are returned by the

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconResult.UseDefault
member.summary: No icon is returned. The calling app should show the default icon for this file type.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconResult.Extracted
member.summary: An icon was returned. The icon must NOT be freed by the calling app.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconResult.ExtractedDestroy
member.summary: An icon was returned. The icon MUST be destroyed by the calling app.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconResult.Delayed
member.summary: This return value is only valid if was NOT set. It tells the calling app to show a default icon, and request the true icon in a background thread.

member.summary: Resume an aborted or failed transfer.

member.summary: A hint from the calling program: The remote file exists and has the same case (upper/lowercase) as the local file.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CopyFlags.ExistsDifferentCase
member.summary: A hint from the calling program: The remote file exists and has different case (upper/lowercase) than the local file.

member.name: F:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CopyFlags.Exists
member.summary: A hint from the calling program: The remote file exists.

member.summary: The file was copied OK

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Progress
member.summary: is a class, which the plugin can use to show copy progress.

remarks.para: This class is received through the function when the plugin is loaded.
You should call this function at least twice in the copy functions , and , at the beginning and at the end. If you can't determine the progress, call it with 0% at the beginning and 100% at the end.

New in 1.3: During the // loop, the plugin may now call the to make a progess dialog appear. This is useful for very slow connections. Don't call for fast connections! The progress dialog will only be shown for normal dir changes, not for compound operations like get/put. The calls to will also be ignored during the first 5 seconds, so the user isn't bothered with a progress dialog on every dir change.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Progress.SetProgress(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Show copy progress.
member.param: Name of the source file being copied. Depending on the direction of the operation (Get, Put), this may be a local file name of a name in the plugin file system.
Name to which the file is copied.
Percentage of THIS file being copied. Total Commander automatically shows a second percent bar if possible when multiple files are copied.
member.returns: Total Commander returns false if the user wants to abort copying, and true if the operation can continue.

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log
member.summary: is a class, which the plugin can use to show the FTP connections toolbar, and to pass log messages to it. Totalcmd can show these messages in the log window (ftp toolbar) and write them to a log file.

remarks.para: This class is received through the function when the plugin is loaded.

Total Commander supports logging to files. While one log file will store all messages, the other will only store important errors, connects, disconnects and complete operations/transfers, but not messages by method.
Do NOT call if your plugin does not require connect/disconnect! If you call it, the function will be called when the user presses the Disconnect button.

Examples:
- FTP requires connect/disconnect, so call LogProc with MSGTYPE_CONNECT when a connection is established.
- Access to local file systems (e.g. Linux EXT2) does not require connect/disconnect

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Connect to a file system requiring disconnect.
member.param: String which should be logged. The string MUST have a specific format: "CONNECT" followed by a single whitespace, then the root of the file system which was connected, without trailing backslash. Example: CONNECT \Filesystem.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.Disconnect(System.String)
member.summary: Disconnected successfully.
member.param: String which should be logged.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.Details(System.String)
member.summary: Not so important messages like directory changing.
member.param: String which should be logged.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.TransferComplete(System.String)
member.summary: A file transfer was completed successfully.
member.param: String which should be logged.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.ConnectComplete(System.String)
member.summary: Unused.
member.param: String which should be logged. The string should contain both the source and target names, separated by an arrow " -> ", e.g. Download complete: \Filesystem\dir1\file1.txt -> c:\localdir\file1.txt

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.ImportantError(System.String)
member.summary: An important error has occured.
member.param: String which should be logged.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log.OperationComplete(System.String)
member.summary: An operation other than a file transfer has completed.
member.param: String which should be logged.

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin
member.summary: Represents file system plugins for Total Commander. File system plugins will show up in Network Neighborhood, not in the new file system.

para.strong: The minimum functions needed for a read-only (browsing) plugin are:

item.description: Initialize the plugin.
Retrieve the first file in a directory.
Get the next file in the directory.
Close the search handle.

para.strong: The following optional functions allow to manipulate individual files.

item.description: Download a file from the plugin file system to a local disk.
Upload a file from the local disk to the plugin file system.
Copy, rename or move a file within the plugin file system.
Delete a file on the plugin file system.
Execute a command or launch a file on the plugin file system, or show properties.
Create a new directory in the plugin file system.
Remove a directory on the plugin file system.
Set the file attributes of a file or directory.
Set the file times.
Extract icon for file list.
Return a bitmap for thumbnail view.
For file systems requiring a connection: User pressed disconnect button.
Informs the plugin that an operation is just going to start or end (purely informational).
These functions are almost identical to the Content* functions of the content plugin interface.

para.strong: There are also 3 classes which the plugin can use:

item.description: Use this to indicate the progress in percent of a single copy operation.
Use to add information to the log file, and to make the FTP toolbar appear.
Request input from the user, e.g. a user name, password etc.

remarks.para: When a user installs the plugin in Total Commander, the plugin is loaded, class implemented interface is found and will be saved to wincmd.ini. Then the plugin will be unloaded. When the user enters Network Neighborhood, Totalcmd will enumerate all plugins listed in wincmd.ini without loading the plugins! A plugin will only be loaded when the user tries to enter the plugin root directory. It's also possible that a user jumps directly to a plugin subdirectory by using the 'directory hotlist' or 'directory history' functions in Totalcmd. When the plugin is loaded, Totalcmd will call .

The framework (Total Commander) will refresh the file list whenever the user enters any directory in the plugin's file system. The same procedure will also be executed if the framework wants to work with subdirectories, e.g. while copying/moving/deleting files in a subdir selected by the user. This is done by recursively calling , , for every directory encountered in the tree. This system will be called FNC (findfirst-next-close) in this text.

For the plugin root, Totalcmd calls with the parameter Path set to "\". The plugin should return all the items in the root, e.g. the drive letters of a remote machine, the available file systems etc. When the returned item has the directory flag set, Totalcmd will use the name to build a subdirectory path. Subdirectories are built by concatenating returned directory names separated by Backslashes, e.g. \drive1\c:\some\subdir.

While downloading or remote-copying whole directory trees, the framework executes a complete FNC loop of a subdir and stores the files in an internal list. Then it checks the list for files and copies these files, and in a second loop it checks the list for directories, and if it encounters them, it recursively copies the subdirs. This allows to recursively copy a whole tree.

For counting the files in subdirs and for deleting files, multiple open file handles are needed. You should therefore initialise a temporary structure whenever is called, return its handle (pointer) to the framework, and delete it in , using that same handle that is now returned to you. It's important to know that there may be multiple open find handles a the same time, although great care is taken to avoid this.
Some framework function may call other functions when the need arises - for instance, is called during moving of files in order to delete the directories that are no longer needed.

Here are some cases when you CAN'T rely on the FNC to get called (because it has already been called before):
- when copying some files in the currently active directory, and there are no directories selected for copying
- when viewing a file with F3
By method, the plugin will be informed every time an operation starts and ends. No plugin functions except for and will be called without an enclosing pair of calls.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.Init(System.Int32,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Progress,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Log,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Request)
member.summary: is called when loading the plugin. The passed values should be stored in the plugin for later use.

class, which contains progress functions.
class, which contains logging functions.
class, which contains request text functions.
member.remarks: is NOT called when the user initially installs the plugin. The plugin DLL is loaded when the user enters the plugin root in Network Neighborhood.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FindFirst(System.String,System.Collections.IEnumerator@)
member.summary: is called to retrieve the first file in a directory of the plugin's file system.
member.param: Full path to the directory for which the directory listing has to be retrieved. Important: no wildcards are passed to the plugin! All separators will be backslashes, so you will need to convert them to forward slashes if your file system uses them! As root, a single backslash is passed to the plugin. All subdirs are built from the directory names the plugin returns through and , separated by single backslashes, e.g. \Some server\c:\subdir
The find enumerator. This enumerator will be passed to by the calling program.

item.term: Return class, which contains the file or directory details. Use the property set to to distinguish files from directories. On Unix systems, you can | (or) the property with 0x80000000 and set the property to the Unix file mode (permissions).
Return if the directory exists, but it's empty (Totalcmd can open it, e.g. to copy files to it).
Return if the directory does not exist, and Total Commander will not try to open it.

member.remarks: may be called directly with a subdirectory of the plugin! You cannot rely on it being called with the root \ after it is loaded. Reason: Users may have saved a subdirectory to the plugin in the Ctrl+D directory hotlist in a previous session with the plugin.

item.term: Return class, which contains the file or directory details. Use the property set to to distinguish files from directories. On Unix systems, you can | (or) the property with 0x80000000 and set the property to the Unix file mode (permissions).
Return if there are no more files.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FindClose(System.Collections.IEnumerator)
member.summary: is called to end a / loop, either after retrieving all files, or when the user aborts it.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FileExecute(TotalCommander.Plugin.TotalCommanderWindow,System.String@,System.String)
member.summary: is called to execute a file on the plugin's file system, or show its property sheet. It is also called to show a plugin configuration dialog when the user right clicks on the plugin root and chooses 'properties'. The plugin is then called with ="\" and ="properties" (requires TC>=5.51).
member.param: Parent window which can be used for showing a property sheet.
Name of the file to be executed, with full path.

This can be either "open", "properties", "chmod" or "quote" (case-insensitive).
open: This is called when the user presses ENTER on a file. There are three ways to handle it:
a) For internal commands like "Add new connection", execute it in the plugin and return or
b) Let Total Commander download the file and execute it locally: return
c) If the file is a (symbolic) link, set to the location to which the link points (including the full plugin path), and return . Total Commander will then switch to that directory. You can also switch to a directory on the local harddisk! To do this, return a path starting either with a drive letter, or an UNC location (\\server\share). The maximum allowed length of such a path is MAX_PATH-1 = 259 characters!
properties: Show a property sheet for the file (optional). Currently not handled by internal Totalcmd functions if is returned, so the plugin needs to do it internally.
chmod xxx: The xxx stands for the new Unix mode (attributes) to be applied to the file . This verb is only used when returning Unix attributes through /
quote commandline: Execute the command line entered by the user in the directory . This is called when the user enters a command in Totalcmd's command line, and presses ENTER. This is optional, and allows to send plugin-specific commands. It's up to the plugin writer what to support here. If the user entered e.g. a cd directory command, you can return the new path in (max 259 characters), and give as return value. Return to cause a refresh (re-read) of the active panel.

item.description: Total Commander should download the file and execute it locally.
The command was executed successfully in the plugin (or if the command isn't applicable and no further action is needed).
Execution failed.
This was a (symbolic) link or .lnk file pointing to a different directory.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FileRenameMove(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.RemoteInfo)
member.summary: is called to transfer (copy or move) a file within the plugin's file system.
member.param: Name of the remote source file, with full path. The name always starts with a backslash, then the names returned by / separated by backslashes.
Name of the remote destination file, with full path. The name always starts with a backslash, then the names returned by / separated by backslashes.
If true, the file needs to be moved to the new location and name. Many file systems allow to rename/move a file without actually moving any of its data, only the pointer to it.
Tells the function whether it should overwrite the target file or not. See notes below on how this parameter is used.
A structure of type which contains the parameters of the file being renamed/moved (not of the target file!).
member.returns:
Return one of the following values:
The file was copied/moved OK.
The target file already exists.
The source file couldn't be found or opened.
There was an error reading from the source file.
There was an error writing to the target file, e.g. disk full.
Copying was aborted by the user (through Progress).
The operation is not supported (e.g. resume).
Not used here.
member.remarks:
Total Commander usually calls this function twice:
- once with == false. If the remote file exists, return . If it doesn't exist, try to copy the file, and return an appropriate error code.
- a second time with == true, if the user chose to overwrite the file.
While copying the file, but at least at the beginning and the end, call to show the copy progress and allow the user to abort the operation.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FileGet(System.String,System.String@,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CopyFlags,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.RemoteInfo)
member.summary: is called to transfer a file from the plugin's file system to the normal file system (drive letters or UNC).
member.param: Name of the file to be retrieved, with full path. The name always starts with a backslash, then the names returned by / separated by backslashes.

Local file name with full path, either with a drive letter or UNC path (\\Server\Share\filename). The plugin may change the NAME/EXTENSION of the file (e.g. when file conversion is done), but not the path!

Can be a combination of the following three flags:
: If set, overwrite any existing file without asking. If not set, simply fail copying.
: Resume an aborted or failed transfer.
: The plugin needs to delete the remote file after uploading.
See below for important notes!

This parameter contains information about the remote file which was previously retrieved via /: The size, date/time, and attributes of the remote file. May be useful to copy the attributes with the file, and for displaying a progress dialog.
member.returns:
Return one of the following values:
The file was copied/moved OK.
The target file already exists.
The source file couldn't be found or opened.
There was an error reading from the source file.
There was an error writing to the target file, e.g. disk full.
Copying was aborted by the user (through Progress).
The operation is not supported (e.g. resume).
The remote file already exists, and resume is supported.

remarks.para:
Total Commander usually calls this function twice:
- once with == or == . If the local file exists and resume is supported, return . If resume isn't allowed, return .
- a second time with or , depending on the user's choice. The resume option is only offered to the user if was returned by the first call.
- and are NEVER passed to this function, because the plugin can easily determine whether a local file exists or not.
- is set, the plugin needs to delete the remote file after a successful download.
While copying the file, but at least at the beginning and the end, call ProgressProc to show the copy progress and allow the user to abort the operation.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FilePut(System.String,System.String@,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CopyFlags)
member.summary: is called to transfer a file from the normal file system (drive letters or UNC) to the plugin's file system.
member.param: Local file name with full path, either with a drive letter or UNC path (\\Server\Share\filename). This file needs to be uploaded to the plugin's file system.

Name of the remote file, with full path. The name always starts with a backslash, then the names returned by / separated by backslashes. The plugin may change the NAME/EXTENSION of the file (e.g. when file conversion is done), but not the path!

Can be a combination of the following three flags:
: If set, overwrite any existing file without asking. If not set, simply fail copying.
: Resume an aborted or failed transfer.
: The plugin needs to delete the remote file after uploading.
: A hint from the calling program: The remote file exists and has the same case (upper/lowercase) as the local file.
: A hint from the calling program: The remote file exists and has different case (upper/lowercase) than the local file.
See below for important notes!
member.returns:
Return one of the following values:
The file was copied/moved OK.
The target file already exists.
The source file couldn't be found or opened.
There was an error reading from the source file.
There was an error writing to the target file, e.g. disk full.
Copying was aborted by the user (through Progress).
The operation is not supported (e.g. resume).
The remote file already exists, and resume is supported.

remarks.para:
Total Commander usually calls this function twice, with the following parameters in :
- once with neither nor set. If the remote file exists and resume is supported, return . If resume isn't allowed, return
- a second time with or , depending on the user's choice. The resume option is only offered to the user if was returned by the first call.
- The flags or are added to when the remote file exists and needs to be overwritten. This is a hint to the plugin to allow optimizations: Depending on the plugin type, it may be very slow to check the server for every single file when uploading.
- If the flag is set, the plugin needs to delete the local file after a successful upload.
While copying the file, but at least at the beginning and the end, call to show the copy progress and allow the user to abort the operation.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.SetDefaultParams(TotalCommander.Plugin.DefaultParam)
member.summary: is called immediately after . This function is new in version 1.3. It requires Total Commander >=5.51, but is ignored by older versions.
member.param: This class of type currently contains the version number of the plugin interface, and the suggested location for the settings file (ini file). It is recommended to store any plugin-specific information either directly in that file, or in that directory under a different name. Make sure to use a unique header when storing data in this file, because it is shared by other file system plugins! If your plugin needs more than 1kbyte of data, you should use your own ini file because ini files are limited to 64k.
member.remarks: This function is only called in Total Commander 5.51 and later. The plugin version will be >= 1.3.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.SetPasswordStore(TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.Password)
member.summary: is called when loading the plugin. The passed value should be stored in the plugin for later use.
member.param: You can use this class to store passwords in Total Commander's secure password store. The user will be asked for the master password automatically.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.GetBackgroundFlags
member.summary: is called by Total Commander 7.51 or newer to determine whether the plugin supports background operations (uploads and downloads), and if yes, how they are supported.
member.returns:
A combination of the following flags:
Background operations are not supported.
Download in background is supported.
Upload in background is supported.
If this flag is set, the user must be asked BEFORE the transfer starts whether the file should be sent/retrieved in background or foreground. This is necessary for plugins where a separate connection is needed for background transfers, e.g. the SFTP (secure ftp) plugin. If the flag isn't set, there will be a "background" button in the actual progress window.

remarks.para: If the flag is set and the user checks the option to transfer the file in background, Total Commander starts a background thread and calls with parameters and instead of for downloads, and instead of for uploads. A corresponding is sent when the transfer is done. These notifications can be used to build up the background connection and to close it when done. You need to use to recognize a background operation. will return the same value for the entire operation in , and .

If the flag is NOT set, all uploads and downloads with F5 or F6 will be started in a background thread. Initially the normal foreground transfer window will be shown, which will be changed to a background transfer window when the user clicks on "Background". For the plugin, the entire operation will take place in the same background thread, though. This method is recommended only for plugins where no extra connections are needed for multiple parallel transfers, or where the additional connections are built up very quickly. Example of a plugin using this method is the WinCE plugin for Windows Mobile devices.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.GetCustomIcon(System.String@,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.CustomIconFlags,System.Drawing.Icon@)
member.summary: is called when a file/directory is displayed in the file list. It can be used to specify a custom icon for that file/directory. This function is new in version 1.1. It requires Total Commander >=5.51, but is ignored by older versions.
member.param: This is the full path to the file or directory whose icon is to be retrieved. When extracting an icon, you can return an icon name here - this ensures that the icon is only cached once in the calling program. The returned icon name must not be longer than MAX_PATH characters (including terminating 0!). The icon handle must still be returned in !

Flags for the extract operation. A combination of the following:
: Requests the small 16x16 icon
: The function is called from the background thread (see note below).
Here you need to return the icon.
member.returns:
The function has to return one of the following values:
No icon is returned. The calling app should show the default icon for this file type.
An icon was returned in . The icon must NOT be freed by the calling app, e.g. because it was loaded with LoadIcon, or the DLL handles destruction of the icon.
An icon was returned in . The icon MUST be destroyed by the calling app, e.g. because it was created with CreateIcon(), or extracted with ExtractIconEx().
This return value is only valid if was NOT set. It tells the calling app to show a default icon, and request the true icon in a background thread. See note below.
member.remarks: If you return , will be called again from a background thread at a later time. A critical section is used by the calling app to ensure that is never entered twice at the same time. This return value should be used for icons which take a while to extract, e.g. EXE icons. In the fsplugin sample plugin, the drive icons are returned immediately (because they are stored in the plugin itself), but the EXE icons are loaded with a delay. If the user turns off background loading of icons, the function will be called in the foreground with the flag.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.GetPreviewBitmap(System.String@,System.Drawing.Size,System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.summary: is called when a file/directory is displayed in thumbnail view. It can be used to return a custom bitmap for that file/directory. This function is new in version 1.4. It requires Total Commander >=7.0, but is ignored by older versions.
member.param: This is the full path to the file or directory whose bitmap is to be retrieved. When extracting a bitmap, you can return a bitmap name here - this ensures that the icon is only cached once in the calling program. The returned bitmap name must not be longer than MAX_PATH characters (including terminating 0!). The bitmap handle must still be returned in !
The maximum dimensions of the preview bitmap. If your image is smaller, or has a different side ratio, then you need to return an image which is smaller than these dimensions! See notes below!
Here you need to return the bitmap.
member.returns:
The function has to return one of the following values:
There is no preview bitmap.
The image was extracted and is returned in .
Tells the caller to extract the image by itself. The full local path to the file needs to be returned in . The returned bitmap name must not be longer than MAX_PATH.
Tells the caller to extract the image by itself, and then delete the temporary image file. The full local path to the temporary image file needs to be returned in . The returned bitmap name must not be longer than MAX_PATH. In this case, the plugin downloads the file to TEMP and then asks TC to extract the image.
This value must be ADDED to one of the above values if the caller should cache the image. Do NOT add this image if you will cache the image yourself!

item.term: This function is only called in Total Commander 7.0 and later. The reported plugin version will be >= 1.4.
The bitmap handle goes into possession of Total Commander, which will delete it after using it. The plugin must not delete the bitmap handle!
This function is only called in Total Commander 7.0 and later. The reported plugin version will be >= 1.4.

Make sure you scale your image correctly to the desired maximum width+height! Do not fill the rest of the bitmap - instead, create a bitmap which is SMALLER than requested! This way, Total Commander can center your image and fill the rest with the default background color.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.IsLinksToLocalFiles
member.summary: indicates that the plugin is a temporary panel-style plugin or a normal file system plugin. Temporary file panels just hold links to files on the local file system.
member.returns: Return true if the plugin is a temporary panel-style plugin. Return false if the plugin is a normal file system plugin.
member.remarks:
If your plugin is a temporary panel plugin, the following functions MUST be thread-safe (can be called from background transfer manager):
-
-
-
-
-
This means that when uploading subdirectories from your plugin to FTP in the background, Total Commander will call these functions in a background thread. If the user continues to work in the foreground, calls to and may be occuring at the same time! Therefore it's very important to use the search handle to keep temporary information about the search. will NOT be called from the background thread!

member.remarks:
If your plugin is a temporary panel plugin, the following functions MUST be thread-safe (can be called from background transfer manager):
-
-

-
-
This means that when uploading subdirectories from your plugin to FTP in the background, Total Commander will call these functions in a background thread. If the user continues to work in the foreground, calls to and may be occuring at the same time! Therefore it's very important to use the search handle to keep temporary information about the search. will NOT be called from the background thread!

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.StatusInfo(System.String,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.StatusOrigin,TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.StatusOperation)
member.summary: is called just as an information to the plugin that a certain operation starts or ends. It can be used to allocate/free buffers, and/or to flush data from a cache.
member.param: This is the current source directory when the operation starts. May be used to find out which part of the file system is affected.

Information whether the operation starts or ends. Possible values:
: Operation starts (allocate buffers if needed)
: Operation has ended (free buffers, flush cache etc)

Information of which operaration starts/ends. Possible values:
Retrieve a directory listing.
Get a single file from the plugin file system.
Get multiple files, may include subdirs.
Put a single file to the plugin file system.
Put multiple files, may include subdirs.
RenMov multiple files, may include subdirs.
Delete multiple files, may include subdirs.
Change attributes/times, may include subdirs.
Create a single directory.
Start a single remote item, or a command line.
Calculating size of subdir (user pressed SPACE).
Searching for file names only (using //).
Searching for file contents (using also calls).
Synchronize dirs searches subdirs for info.
Synchronize: Downloading files from plugin.
Synchronize: Uploading files to plugin.
Synchronize: Deleting files from plugin.
Get multiple files, may include subdirs in background thread.
Put multiple files, may include subdirs in background thread.

remarks.para: Please note that future versions of the framework may send additional values!

This function has been added for the convenience of plugin writers. All calls to plugin functions will be enclosed in a pair of calls. Multiple plugin calls can be between these two calls. For example, a download may contain multiple calls to , and , , (for copying subdirs).
Please also note that this function is only called for file operations. It isn't called for any of the Content* functions to get file details, and also not for the following functions: , , , .

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.Disconnect(System.String)
member.summary: is called when the user presses the Disconnect button in the FTP connections toolbar. This toolbar is only shown if is called.
member.param: This is the root dir which was passed to when connecting. It allows the plugin to have serveral open connections to different file systems (e.g. ftp servers). Should be either \ (for a single possible connection) or \Servername (e.g. when having multiple open connections).
member.returns: Return true if the connection was closed (or never open), false if it couldn't be closed.

remarks.para: To get calls to this function, the plugin MUST call . The parameter MUST start with "CONNECT", followed by one whitespace and the root of the file system which has been connected. This file system root will be passed to when the user presses the Disconnect button, so the plugin knows which connection to close. Do NOT call if your plugin does not require connect/disconnect!

- FTP requires connect/disconnect. Connect can be done automatically when the user enters a subdir, disconnect when the user clicks the Disconnect button.
- Access to local file systems (e.g. Linux EXT2) does not require connect/disconnect, so don't call .

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.OnError(System.Exception)
member.summary: Called when an exception occurs.
member.param: The error.

member.name: P:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.ITotalCommanderWfxPlugin.PluginName
member.summary: The default root name which should appear in the Network Neighborhood.
member.remarks: This root name is NOT part of the path passed to the plugin when Totalcmd accesses the plugin file system! The root will always be "\", and all subpaths will be built from the directory names returned by the plugin.

member.summary: alled to retrieve the next file in a directory of the plugin's file system.

member.name: M:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.TotalCommanderWfxPlugin.FindClose(System.Collections.IEnumerator)

member.summary: Currently unused. If available, set to the time when the file was last accessed.

member.name: P:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.FindData.Reserved0
member.summary: On Unix systems, you can | (or) the field with 0x80000000 and set the parameter to the Unix file mode (permissions). These will then be shown in Totalcmd can can be changed through Files - Change attributes.

member.name: P:TotalCommander.Plugin.Wfx.FindData.Reserved1
member.summary: Unused, must be set to 0. Reserved for future plugin enhancements.

member.name: T:TotalCommander.Plugin.DefaultParam
member.summary: contains information about the current plugin interface version and ini file location.

member.name: P:TotalCommander.Plugin.DefaultParam.PluginInterfaceVersion
member.summary: Plugin interface version.

member.name: P:TotalCommander.Plugin.DefaultParam.DefaultIniFileName
member.summary: Suggested location+name of the ini file where the plugin could store its data. This is a fully qualified path+file name, and will be in the same directory as the wincmd.ini. It's recommended to store the plugin data in this file or at least in this directory, because the plugin directory or the Windows directory may not be writable!
